thread.title: RB Leipzig: Champions League ban in the works due to Uefa rules which target companies owning more than one club
thread.title_full: RB Leipzig: Champions League ban in the works due to Uefa rules which target companies owning more than one club

author: achapman
title: RB Leipzig: Champions League ban in the works due to Uefa rules which target companies owning more than one club
text:
EFL Leip of Faith RB Leipzig: Champions League ban in the works due to Uefa rules which target companies owning more than one club 
Bundesliga surprise package owned by Red Bull but they also control Austrian giants and Euro regulars RB Salzburg By ANTHONY CHAPMAN Comments GERMAN surprise package RB Leipzig could be banned from next season’s Champions League, according to reports. 
The Bundesliga minnows are owned by drinks manufacturer Red Bull and have enjoyed an fairytale debut in the top flight this season. Getty Images 3 RB Leipzig are in danger of being banned from European competition 
Leipzig currently sit second in the table, five points behind Bayern Munich and eight ahead of Borussia Dortmund , but fans of other clubs aren’t happy with their corporate links. Keep up to date with ALL the RB Leipzig news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
However, those opposed may have something to smile about soon though, as Uefa will only allow ONE team owned by the same company to participate in either the Champions OR Europa League. 
Leipzig have a sister team in the form of Austrian giants RB Salzburg, who are regulars in European competition. Violence breaks out between Borussia Dortmund and RB Leipzig fans Getty Images 3 The Germans are currently sitting in second despite it being their first-ever Bundesliga campaign 
And with both sides looking likely to book a place in the Champions League via their respective league positions, Salzburger Nachrichten claims one will be forced to miss out. 
A Uefa spokesman said: “This will be verified by Uefa once we have received the competition entry forms from the national football associations after the end of the season in the respective leagues.” Related Articles dor closed Borussia Dortmund to face part stadium closure and £85,500 fine after crowd violence in clash with RB Leipzig STAYING FORS NOW Arsenal and Liverpool target Emil Forsberg signs new five-year contract with RB Leipzig SAUSAGE PARTY Bayern Munich thank Ingolstadt for beating title rivals RB Leipzig with a truck load of bangers and pretzels ON THE UP Who is Dayot Upamecano? Manchester United transfer target and Red Bull Leipzig wonderkid - here's what we know Getty Images 3 Sister club RB Salzburg are also owned by Red Bull, which contravenes Uefa rules 
But Leipzig CEO Oliver Mintzlaff is confident that both Red Bulls teams will be unaffected in the new campaign. 
He added: “We are not nervous at RB Leipzig and also the Uefa signals don’t exit. If we qualify there is no reason why we should doubt to play in Europe next season.”
